title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The y's are already opposites so they will be eliminated once we add up the two equations. $$3x-2y=1$$ $$-x+2y=9$$

title: Add the Equations to Eliminate One Variable
text: Add the x's, y's, and constants. y will be eliminated and then solve for x. $$2x=10$$ $$x=5$$

title: Substitute Solution into Original Equations
text: Substitute $$x=5$$ into the first equation, $$3x-2y=1$$. Then solve for y. $$3x-2y=1$$ $$3\times5-2y=1$$ $$15-2y=1$$ $$-2y=-14$$ $$y=7$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is (5,7).
